title: Zelenskyy at White House: How Ukrainian president dressed this time; meets Trump
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy chose a more relaxed style, sporting a black jacket instead of a suit, for his White House meeting with US President Donald Trump and European leaders. This decision follows reports that Trump was previously annoyed by Zelenskyy's informal attire during an earlier visit.

title: PM Modi chairs economic meet; next-generation GST reforms discussed
content: Prime Minister Modi convened a high-level meeting to outline 'next-generation reforms,' including GST revisions, aiming to ease living and boost business. Following his Independence Day promise of a 'Diwali gift' of lighter taxes, the Centre proposed simplifying GST with two primary tax slabs.

title: 'Without any amendments': Hamas accepts new Gaza truce plan; hostages to be freed in batches
content: Hamas has accepted a new ceasefire proposal for Gaza without amendments, according to a source within the group, signaling a potential breakthrough in the conflict. Mediators from Egypt and Qatar, with US support, are working to finalize the agreement, which aims to secure a lasting truce and address the humanitarian crisis.

title: 'Entire country will ask for your affidavit': Rahul slams EC; calls SIR a new form of 'vote theft'
content: During his "Voter Adhikaar Yatra" in Gaya, Rahul Gandhi accused the Election Commission of vote manipulation and criticised their demand for an affidavit regarding his "vote chori" allegations. He warned election officials of potential action if an INDIA bloc government is formed, alleging irregularities in Bihar's SIR exercise and past elections in Maharashtra and Haryana.

title: Mass layoffs: CEO laid off 80% employees two years ago; now says that he‚Ä¶.
content: IgniteTech CEO Eric Vaughan replaced nearly 80% of his workforce in 2023 due to resistance to the company's AI adoption mandate. Despite employee sabotage and refusal to participate, the transformation led to substantial returns, including the launch of two AI solutions and high profit margins. Vaughan doesn't recommend this strategy, citing cultural resistance as the cause.

title: 'Differences must not become disputes': Jaishankar in talks with China FM Wang Yi ‚Äì Key points
content: Foreign Minister Wang Yi's visit to New Delhi marks a renewed effort to improve Sino-Indian relations. Wang's meeting with S Jaishankar and participation in border talks with Ajit Doval, follows agreements made between Modi and Xi in Kazan. China aims to build political trust, expand cooperation, and manage differences for stable bilateral ties.

title: India Asia Cup 2025 Squad: When will it be announced? Date, timing, venue confirmed
content: The BCCI is set to announce India's 15-member squad for the ACC Men‚Äôs Asia Cup 2025 on August 19, following a selection meeting in Mumbai. Suryakumar Yadav is expected to lead the team, with key T20 performers likely to be favored. Jasprit Bumrah returns, while India prepares for matches against UAE and Pakistan in the UAE-based tournament.

title: 'ChatGPT ruined my dream vacation', says influencer as their crying photo goes viral
content: Mery Caldass, a Spanish influencer, missed her romantic getaway to Puerto Rico after relying on ChatGPT for travel advice. The AI chatbot provided incorrect information about visa requirements, leading to her missing the flight. This incident isn't isolated, as another individual was hospitalized after following ChatGPT's dietary guidance, highlighting the potential risks of relying solely on AI for critical information.

title: PM Modi meets Shubhanshu Shukla; astronaut shows Earth photos clicked from ISS
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla, celebrating his Axiom-4 mission to the ISS and India's growing space capabilities. Shukla shared pictures from space and received accolades in Parliament, though the Opposition's boycott drew criticism. India's space ambitions, including the Gaganyaan program and a planned space station, were highlighted, with the first module expected by 2028.

title: ‚ÄòSkibidi‚Äô, ‚Äòdelulu‚Äô & ‚Äòbroligarchy‚Äô among 6,000 new words added to Cambridge Dictionary
content: The Cambridge Dictionary has embraced internet culture by adding 6,000 new words, including TikTok slang like 'skibidi,' 'delulu,' and 'tradwife.' This update reflects how deeply online trends now shape modern English, prompting debate about language evolution. While some celebrate the recognition of digital slang, others criticize its impact on linguistic standards, highlighting the growing influence of internet-born terms.

title: Putin-Modi talks: Russian president dials PM; shares insights on Alaska meet with Trump
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi received a call from Russian President Vladimir Putin, who shared insights from his recent Alaska meeting with US President Donald Trump regarding a proposed peace deal. PM Modi reaffirmed India's consistent advocacy for a peaceful resolution to the Ukraine conflict and expressed support for all efforts aimed at achieving that goal.

title: Microsoft's new return to office plan: Company requires 3-day office attendance
content: Microsoft will require employees near its Redmond headquarters to work in the office at least three days a week starting in January 2025, potentially leading to resignations. This shift reverses previous flexibility and aligns Microsoft with other tech giants mandating in-office attendance. Employees view the policy as a possible "stealth layoff" amid concerns about office space and resources, despite the company's strong financial performance.

title: Julian Sayin named Ohio State starter: Set for college debut; showdown vs Texas awaits
content: Julian Sayin, the redshirt freshman transfer from Alabama, has been named Ohio State's starting quarterback, succeeding in a close competition against Lincoln Kienholz. Coach Ryan Day announced the decision ahead of the highly anticipated season opener against No. 1 ranked Texas. Day emphasized Sayin's consistency, leadership, and smart decision-making as key factors in earning the role.

title: Mahomes: I didn‚Äôt believe Kelce at first about dating Taylor Swift
content: Patrick Mahomes initially doubted Travis Kelce's relationship with Taylor Swift, needing to witness it to believe it. He acknowledged the increased buzz and attention Swift brought to the stadium. Mahomes also praised Swift's dedication to her new album, revealed on Kelce's podcast, as both athletes focus on their comeback after a Super Bowl loss.

title: Ayesha Curry shares sweet clip of baby Cai ‚Äòwalking‚Äô like dad Steph
content: Ayesha Curry shared heartwarming moments on Instagram, showcasing baby Cai following in Stephen Curry's basketball footsteps. The post featured Cai enthusiastically dunking a ball, capturing the attention of fans. Amidst Stephen's Curry Camp, Ayesha keeps fans updated on their family life, including celebrating their 14th wedding anniversary with a touching message for her husband.

title: Canadiens goalie Samuel Montembeault marries longtime love in Montreal
content: Montreal Canadiens goaltender Samuel Montembeault and Daryanne Ayotte celebrated their wedding in Montreal after seven years of relationship. The ceremony was attended by family, friends, and Canadiens teammates, including Brendan Gallagher and Nick Suzuki. With the wedding concluding a busy offseason, the team now shifts focus to the upcoming rookie camp and the 2025-26 NHL season.

title: Braxton Berrios shines on field: Alix Earle steals spotlight in country outfit
content: Braxton Berrios, the Houston Texans' wide receiver, celebrated a Week 2 preseason victory against the Carolina Panthers, 20-3. Adding to the excitement, his girlfriend, social media influencer Alix Earle, was present to support him. Earle shared moments from the game, including a sweet sideline embrace with Berrios, on her Instagram. Her country-western outfit also grabbed attention.

title: Top 2 T20I run-scorers for both India and Pakistan won't be part of Asia Cup 2025 - here is why
content: The 2025 T20 Asia Cup will see India and Pakistan without key players. Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli have retired. Pakistan dropped Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan. Salman Ali Agha will lead Pakistan in a preparatory series. Pakistan faces India, UAE, and Oman in Group A. India's squad is still awaited. The Asia Cup concludes on September 28.

title: 'When confronted & destroyed!' Trump links Hamas' fate to hostage return
content: Donald Trump asserted that the release of hostages held by Hamas hinges on the group's confrontation and destruction. He emphasized his past achievements in securing hostage releases and resolving conflicts, highlighting his role in freeing hundreds of hostages and ending multiple wars. Trump urged decisive action, advocating for a strategy focused on victory.

title: Asia Cup: What‚Äôs India‚Äôs head-to-head record against Pakistan?
content: The 2025 Asia Cup, set in the UAE from September 9-28, will be in the T20 format, highlighted by the India vs Pakistan clash on September 14 in Dubai. This tournament serves as crucial preparation for the T20 World Cup 2026.

title: YSRCP backs CP Radhakrishnan: Jagan's party supports NDA nominee
content: The YSR Congress Party, with its 11 MPs, has pledged its support to NDA's vice-presidential candidate, C P Radhakrishnan, bolstering the ruling alliance's prospects. YSRCP MP Maddila Gurumoorthy confirmed the party's backing, even as the opposition gears up to nominate its own candidate. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh reportedly contacted YSR Congress chief Jagan Mohan Reddy to secure the endorsement.

title: Exports to US likely saw 7x faster growth vs overall rise
content: Indian exports to the US surged by 21% due to frontloading in anticipation of Trump's tariffs, overshadowing overall export growth. While exporters are offering discounts to retain business amidst uncertainty, concerns remain about sustaining operations if tariffs reach 50%. Industry leaders are seeking government support to mitigate potential job losses, particularly in the MSME sector.

title: 'Don‚Äôt make Vaibhav Suryavanshi wait': Team India's Asia Cup squad selection debate receives fresh twist
content: Kris Srikkanth, former India captain, has surprisingly advocated for 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi's inclusion in the Asia Cup T20 squad. Suryavanshi's impressive IPL 2025 performance and U19 tour of England have made him a strong contender. Srikkanth emphasizes Suryavanshi's maturity and shot-making ability, urging selectors to consider him for the upcoming T20 World Cup.

title: 'EC must first affirm voter list is clean, then we'll comply': INDIA bloc steps up attack
content: The INDIA bloc has criticised the Election Commission. Opposition leaders allege misconduct in recent elections. They question the special revision of electoral rolls in Bihar. Concerns were raised about voter list irregularities in Maharashtra and Karnataka. Trinamool Congress leader Mahua Moitra called for dissolving the Lok Sabha. The opposition demands accountability from the Election Commission.

title: Sophie Cunningham injury update: How the Indiana fever guard got injured
content: Sophie Cunningham sustained a right knee injury during a game against Connecticut Sun. The incident occurred in the second quarter. Cunningham's injury adds to the Fever's existing injury woes. An MRI is scheduled to determine the extent of the damage. Fans and teammates express their support. The team is awaiting the MRI results.

title: NASA locks volunteers in Mars simulation: PS4 keeps them sane
content: In a groundbreaking experiment, NASA's CHAPEA mission simulated Martian life for over a year, confining four volunteers to a habitat. Beyond survival and adaptation, the crew discovered an unexpected benefit in PS4 gaming. Video games helped maintain cognitive sharpness, reduce stress, and improve problem-solving skills.

title: MP shocker: Class 2 student found dead under mysterious circumstances in hostel; probe under way
content: A Class 2 student, Anurag (7), was discovered dead in the Gyan Ganga School hostel in Khajuraho, Madhya Pradesh. His roommate found him unresponsive, and authorities were alerted. While no external injuries were visible, blue marks were noted on his body, prompting police to investigate potential poisoning or insect bites.

title: B-schools see non-engineers rise: Engineering dominance cracks; What‚Äôs behind the management reset?
content: India‚Äôs elite B-schools are witnessing a paradigm shift: engineers no longer dominate MBA classrooms. Non-engineers‚Äîeconomists, commerce graduates, and humanities students‚Äîare now matching or surpassing their peers in institutes like IIM Ahmedabad, Lucknow, and Indore. Changing corporate demands, revamped admission policies, and rising aspirations among non-engineers are driving this transformation, signaling the end of engineering monopoly in management education.

title: Bumrah offered fresh advice on workload: 'Our physios are the better judges'
content: Former BCCI chairman Chetan Sharma has defended Jasprit Bumrah's decision to play only three Tests against England, citing workload management based on medical advice. Sharma expressed confidence in India's chances at the upcoming Asia Cup, emphasising the team's strong performance and the advantage of hosting the T20 World Cup in 2026.

title: 'Seriously controversial': Trump questions accuracy of voting machines; vows to end mail-in ballots
content: Donald Trump announced a movement to eliminate mail-in ballots and voting machines before the 2026 midterms, citing "massive voter fraud." He plans an executive order targeting voting machines and advocates for watermarked paper ballots, claiming they're faster and more reliable.

title: How Gavin Newsom is out-trumping Trump
content: That viral split screen of scarf vs fatigues was meant to define who had grit and who had privilege. But in modern politics, biography matters less than performance. Vance leveraged his Marine past to ride Trump‚Äôs coattails into the vice presidency. Newsom is leveraging parody to carve out space as the Democrat unafraid of MAGA. Act one was the split screen. Act two is the troll war. Act three, if it comes, will be 2028 ‚Äî where Gavin Newsom will either be remembered as the liberal who cosplayed Trump for a season or the Democrat who figured out how to use memes to win power. Could he be the Lyndon Johnson of the meme era ‚Äî underestimated, even mocked, until history forced him into greatness? That remains unanswered. But for now, MAGA finally knows what it feels like to be on the receiving end of ridicule. And Gavin Newsom is laughing loudest.

title: Arjun Tendulkar engaged to Saaniya Chandok: How has Sachin's son performed on the field?
content: Arjun Tendulkar, son of cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar, recently got engaged to Saaniya Chandok, who hails from a prominent Mumbai business family. The private, family-oriented ceremony marks a joyous occasion for both families.

title: Airtel down: Thousands of users unable to make calls, access internet data
content: Airtel is currently grappling with a significant service outage, impacting thousands of subscribers who are reporting disruptions in both voice and data services since approximately 3:30 PM. Users are expressing their frustration on X, highlighting issues with making calls, sending messages, and accessing mobile internet.

title: Mumbai rains: Heavy showers flood roads tracks, bring city to standstill - video
content: Mumbai was hit by torrential rainfall, leading to severe waterlogging and traffic disruptions across the city. Several areas recorded over 100 mm of rain in just six hours, paralyzing transportation and prompting school closures.

title: 'India like shining Mercedes': Pak interior min echoes Munir's crude analogy
content: Pakistan's Interior Minister Mohsin Naqvi has escalated tensions with India by repeating a controversial analogy made by Army Chief Asim Munir, comparing India to a ‚Äúshining Mercedes‚Äù and Pakistan to a ‚Äúdump truck.‚Äù This statement, initially made during a Saudi delegation visit aimed at de-escalating border tensions, has drawn criticism.

title: 'You‚Äôre Tharoor in saree': Priyanka shares humorous moment - see how Shashi responded
content: Priyanka Chaturvedi's podcast banter with Smika Prakash, referencing Shashi Tharoor, sparked a witty exchange online. Chaturvedi, part of a delegation highlighting India's anti-terrorism stance post-Operation Sindoor, emphasized representing the nation abroad despite being a vocal opposition member domestically. She also criticized the Election Commission of India, expressing concerns about eroding public trust and perceived bias towards the BJP.

title: Exclusive | 'Don't underestimate Shubman Gill' - Harbhajan Singh
content: With the Asia Cup 2025 squad set to be announced, Harbhajan Singh has backed Shubman Gill for inclusion despite stiff competition from India‚Äôs power-hitters. Bhajji insisted Gill‚Äôs solid basics and adaptability make him a potential T20 dominator. Calling this a ‚Äúnew era‚Äù without Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, Harbhajan praised the youngsters for carrying forward Indian cricket‚Äôs legacy.

title: 9-year-old girl dies due to 'brain-eating amoeba' in Kerala
content: A nine-year-old girl from Thamarassery, Kerala, succumbed to a brain infection. The infection was due to Naegleria fowleri. Health officials confirmed the death. This is the fourth reported case in the district this year. Authorities are investigating the source of the infection. Experts advise caution when swimming in freshwater. They also recommend using sterile water for nasal cleaning.

title: Watch: Bhuni toll plaza vandalised following assault on army jawan
content: An Army jawan, Kapil Kavad, was assaulted at Bhuni Toll Plaza in Meerut, triggering a violent reaction from villagers. They stormed the toll, vandalizing property and confronting staff. Police have arrested four individuals and deployed a heavy force to the area, while CCTV footage is being reviewed as part of the ongoing investigation.

title: ‚ÄòAnother war may happen‚Äô: Khamenei‚Äôs aide warns US, Israel
content: A top advisor to Iran's Supreme Leader warned that renewed conflict with the U.S. or Israel could erupt anytime, escalating regional tensions. Yahya Rahim Safavi emphasized Iran's need to bolster its defenses across all sectors. This warning follows reported Israeli strikes on Iranian command centers and U.S.

title: Government survey shows dip in unemployment rate
content: The Labour Bureau found that the unemployment rate in the country has come down by 0.4 percentile points to 5.2% in July from 5.6% in June

title: V-P polls | Rajnath canvasses in support of Radhakrishnan, YSRCP pledges to back NDA candidate
content: Rajnath reaches out to non-NDA parties such as the DMK, YSRCP and BJD; DMK unlikely to support NDA pick; Radhakrishnan expected to file his nominations for the election on August 20

title: Rain wreaks havoc in Maharashtra, brings Mumbai to a standstill
content: Four lakh hectares of cropland destroyed; 177 mm rain was reported within six hours in Mumbai; several flights were diverted, schools shut, buses rerouted, and local trains delayed

title: W.B. CM announces scheme for migrant workers facing harassment in other States
content: Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee says about 10,000 people have returned to the State in the past few months after being targeted in different States

title: Country will ask for affidavit from Election Commission of India: Rahul Gandhi
content: Rahul Gandhi, who urged the people of Bihar to prevent vote theft in the upcoming Assembly election and teach the poll body and the Prime Minister a ‚Äúlesson‚Äù, says that once the INDIA bloc forms the government at the Centre, it will take ‚Äústrict action‚Äù against CEC Gyanesh Kumar

title: Property documents, digital devices seized during ED searches on premises linked to Minister I. Periyasamy
content: The Directorate of Enforcement says the search team also found certain ‚Äòpaper companies‚Äô being operated from the premises of Irulappa Mills, in which Mr. Periyasamy and his younger son P. Prabhu are directors. The accounts of these companies are being verified

title: Offence of sexually assaulting a minor can be alleged even against a woman, rules Karnataka High Court
content: It refuses to quash a criminal case against a woman for allegedly compelling a 13-year-old boy to have sex with her

title: Minister promises thorough inquiry into maternal, infant deaths in Belagavi hospital
content: Sharan Prakash Patil was responding to a query by Congress member M. Nagaraj in the Legislative Council

title: Lokesh meets five Union Ministers, seeks speedy clearances for A.P. projects¬†
content: He urges External Affairs Minister to help Andhra Pradesh in forging collaborations with Singapore and other countries; requests Nitin Gadkari‚Äôs nod for laying of a 56-km-long greenfield highway connecting Kuppam, Hosur and Bengaluru

title: Madras High Court refuses interim relief in TVK flag dispute case
content: Justice Senthilkumar Ramamoorthy rejects an application filed by a trust seeking an interim injunction against the party and its leader C. Joseph Vijay

title: IISc team‚Äôs new findings may have therapeutic implications in treating diabetes
content: The study shows how entry of glucose into the cell to kickstart insulin release falters in Type 2 diabetes and how restoring it could open new therapeutic avenues

title: Spillway discharge of flood at Sriramsagar begins with heavy inflows since Aug. 15
content: Release of water from the projects to FFC taken up to fill MMD, LMD, online reservoirs of Kaleshwaram project

title: In Bargarh rally, BJD reconnects with its base among farmers¬†
content: The regional party has alleged the incumbent BJP-led State government created difficulties for farmers with complex rules to register for paddy procurement

title: Kerala govt. amends controversial order on HSS Principals
content: The order, which required higher secondary Principals to do the job of clerks, amended in the wake of complaints. Teachers point out that they have to work even after school hours to complete their responsibilities

title: Bars pegged at 840, timings extended till midnight under new policy in A.P.
content: Additional 10% licences for toddy tappers, allotment to be made through draw of lots for a three-year term beginning Sept. 1; no permission at religious places, barred along routes leading to Alipiri and Tirumala

title: Ohio State names Sayin starting QB vs. Texas
content: Ohio State has named second-year player Julian Sayin as its starting quarterback for its season opener against No. 1 Texas at Ohio Stadium.

title: Wolf: Pats willing to trade a top pick to help team
content: Patriots executive Eliot Wolf said Monday that the team is open for business if a significant trade opportunity presents itself and indicated he'd be willing to trade a first- or second-round draft pick.

title: Browns name veteran QB Flacco Week 1 starter
content: Joe Flacco will open the season as the Cleveland Browns' starting quarterback, the team announced Monday.

title: Texas, Penn St. lead AP preseason All-Americans
content: Texas edge rusher Colin Simmons is among three Longhorns on The Associated Press All-America team. No. 2 Penn State also had three players, giving the Nittany Lions and Longhorns the most on the team.

title: Stafford practicing for first time in training camp
content: Rams quarterback Matthew Stafford is suited up and practicing Monday with the team for the first time in training camp.

title: Omaha forward Mayar dies in drowning incident
content: Omaha Mavericks forward Deng Mayar, who transferred from North Dakota this offseason, died Saturday in a drowning incident.

title: Bills called out by McDermott after blowout loss
content: Bills coach Sean McDermott said his team's blowout preseason loss to the Bears was "certainly not up to our standard."

content: Mike Clay provides his blueprint for 2025 fantasy football drafts, including ideal selections in each round and overall strategy.

content: Vick is coaching just 30 miles from where he grew up, and in the state where he electrified college football as a player.

content: Will Bradley choose himself to play at ? Who are locks to make the team? We answer some of the biggest questions with six captain's picks left to fill out the team.

content: Carlos Alcaraz and Emma Raducanu say they're just friends. But a growing group of their fans is rooting for far more than just a US Open mixed doubles title. Welcome to the world of tennis shippers.

content: These players are truly for those in deeper leagues seeking off-the-radar types who may emerge in 2025.

content: After visits with 10 NFL teams in eight states, Ben Solak compiled the best things he heard -- and saw -- throughout the trip.

content: Las Vegas, .500 at the All-Star break, has won seven straight and is vying to host early WNBA playoff games.

content: What numbers are teams focused on with just over a month until camp? Zach Kram runs down the big stat for all 30 franchises.

content: We're back for the 2025-26 and Gab Marcotti has a lot to unpack from opening weekend! From Arsenal's win over Man United to Barcelona's hot start, let's recap the weekend.

content: Looking at Eberechi Eze's disallowed free kick for Crystal Palace at Chelsea, and Marcos Senesi's possible red card against Liverpool.

content: Two-time former US Open champion Venus Williams will play again this week. And she still has one major career goal.

title: How clubs are using loyalty against unhappy or unwanted stars
content: Loyalty is a virtue, but in football business comes first. Isak is now walking the rocky path previously taken by stars like Alexander-Arnold and Kane.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United braced for Chelsea's opening Garnacho bid
content: Manchester United will hold firm on their valuation of Chelsea target Alejandro Garnacho. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

content: Nearly 40 years after their time in the NFL, the players from the 1988 New Orleans Saints grapple with the physical toll of football while honoring a bond forged through the toughest game.

content: Who won the recent Texans-Eagles trade? What about the Jalen Ramsey-Minkah Fitzpatrick swap? We sized up the offseason's trades.

content: The superstar debuted on Jason and Travis Kelce's "New Heights" podcast, talked about becoming a football fan -- and even caught Caitlin Clark's attention.

content: We simulated best-case and worst-case scenarios for every team, and our NFL reporters picked the biggest variables.

content: Despite backlash, MSG Entertainment's "attorney exclusion list" is still in effect, reportedly banning over a thousand lawyers since 2022.

title: Shubhanshu Shukla meets PM Modi; gifts tri-colour that travelled to space
content: Shubhanshu Shukla gifted the Prime Minister the mission patch of the Axiom-4 mission and the Indian tricolour that he had taken with him to the ISS

content: Union Ministers Rajnath Singh, Amit Shah, Nitin Gadkari, Nirmala Sitharaman, Shivraj Singh Chouhan, Piyush Goyal and Lalan Singh attended the meeting

title: Police deploy drones to monitor rain and flood situation in Eluru
content: Police say as the neighbouring Telangana is receiving heavy rains in the upstream villages, flood levels in Kolleru Lake have seen a rise leading to roads being submerged and many villages cut off

title: Nine proposals, including Gold Cluster in Mangalagiri, get CRDA nod
content: ‚Çπ904 crore sanctioned for infrastructure works in 29 capital region villages; projects should reflect iconic designs and international standards, says CM

title: Nellore school headmaster‚Äôs passion for photography grabs him global accolades
content: K. Surya Prakasa Rao has received 68 gold medals and 130 recognitions in the fine-art photography during the last couple of years

title: Dharmasthala case: Home Minister warns of action against those posting provocative and defamatory content on social media
content: The Home Minister‚Äôs warning comes as a response to the Opposition MLAs‚Äô demand to act against You Tubers whom they accused of indulging in a smear campaign

content: The Hindu Sales and Distribution vice-president shared his insights on media and business during an interactive session with students of  PVP Siddhartha Institute of Technology

content: Authorities have advised people living in low-lying areas to shift to safer places along with their cattle

content: NDA govt. managed to fulfil its electoral promises in spite of constraints in the last one year but the YSRCP is trying all the tricks to show the govt. in poor light, says Naidu

content: But citizens will have to go to the station to register a formal complaint with supporting documents

content: Seeking a CBI probe, petitioner says there has been misappropriation of funds, including those from the Central govt., allotted to the board

title: Kerala‚Äôs Okkal Seed Farm bags carbon-neutral tag
content: The farm emitted 221.67 tonnes of carbon dioxide equivalent in 2024, according to a study. These emissions were fully offset through a UNFCCC-registered project, earning the farm its carbon-neutral status

title: Parliamentary proceedings: Guwahati to get new IIM
content: The Centre has proposed a Bill to establish an Indian Institute of Management in Guwahati; the institute will get a corpus fund of ‚Çπ555 crore for the first five years

title: Literary festival dedicates a day to children
content: The event, which had sessions on inclusivity, science, and literature, termed a milestone. Children were delivered one message primarily ‚Äî read, read, read.

content: ‚ÄòMysuru and Kodagu have a rich sporting heritage ranging from Vajra Musti wrestling and Mallakhamba in Mysuru to the globally renowned hockey tradition of Kodagu, along with Kabaddi, Kho-Kho, and yoga-based fitness disciplines that are deeply rooted in the cultural fabric of the region‚Äô

content: Intense spells in the second half of August makes up for reduction in rainfall activity in the first two weeks

content: Since 1989, 2,024 couples have been married through such mass weddings at the shrine, says MLA for Hanur

content: ‚ÄòA portion of an old pond, which is a part of the historic Bidanur fort at Nagara in Hosanagara taluk of Shivamogga district, collapsed due to heavy rains on Sunday night‚Äô

title: Kerala HC seeks instructions from government on graft charges against former Kannur district panchayat chief P.P. Divya
content: KSU leader alleges bid to sabotage probe against Ms. Divya in connection with alleged ‚Äúcorruption and benami property transactions to the tune of crores of rupees‚Äù

title: CPI(M) threatens to blockade NHAI officials‚Äô houses over NH 544 gridlock
content: Accusing authorities of negligence that leave commuters stranded for hours, party says the issue should be resolved by August 21. Two days ago there was an 18-hour-long traffic jam on the Ernakulam-Thrissur stretch

title: Attack on Election Commission of India by Rahul, Opposition reflects frustration at losing polls: BJP
content: ‚ÄúHow to win elections through intruders, how to use intruders, how to carry forward appeasement politics ‚Äî this is what the Congress and Rahul Gandhi have been doing,‚Äù says Sambit Patra

title: Supreme Court defers hearing Punjab government‚Äôs plea over delay in clearing Bills
content: The Chief Justice said the petition would be taken up only after a Constitution Bench answers a Presidential Reference on whether the court can set timelines for Governors and the President to act on State Bills

title: At IDSFFK, package of films from Annecy International Animation Film Festival to be screened
content: The 17th International Documentary and Short Film Festival of Kerala (IDSFFK) will held from August 22 to 27 in Thiruvananthapuram.

title: BJP president Nadda hails Modi, slams Nehru over Indus Waters Treaty
content: Nadda says Prime Minister Modi puts the Indus Water Treaty in abeyance, correcting Nehru‚Äôs ‚ÄòHimalayan blunder‚Äô

title: UPSC-Kerala PSC exams‚Äô date clash sparks concern among aspirants
content: The SI Mains exam is scheduled for August 30, which coincides with one of the dates of the UPSC Mains exam.

title: Officials appeal to people of Mandya dist. to celebrate Ganesha festival, Id Milad in peaceful manner
content: The organisers should apply for permission at the single window counters set up in taluk offices, mentioning the date of installation, duration, date and place of immersion, and the route map for processions

title: Health dept. prepares action plan ahead of Sabarimala season
content: The Konni medical college hospital will function as the base hospital, where more facilities will be created, says Health Minister. Extra beds will be arranged in hospitals in Pathanamthitta, Alappuzha, Kottayam and Idukki districts

title: VP polls: PM Modi meets NDA pick CP Radhakrishnan; conveys wishes - see pics

title: 'If it means going to jail ‚Ä¶': Air Canada union chief defies back-to-work order; strike enters day 3
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . read More 8 simple habits that will help reduce stress on the eyes and improve vision naturally 8 times .

title: Norway royal scandal: Crown princess‚Äôs son charged with rapes; prosecutors cite video, photos
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, providing a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers .

title: Drunk UP Man Jumps Into Yamuna After Throwing 2 Daughters Into River
content: A 28-year-old man allegedly threw his two minor daughters into the Yamuna river from the Juhi bridge in Rampura on Monday morning before jumping in himself, the police said.

title: MK Stalin's 7 Questions After Poll Body Chief Defends Bihar Poll Roll Revision
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister and DMK president MK Stalin on Monday intensified his attack on the Election Commission of India (ECI), accusing it of "voter theft" through mass deletions under the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) process in Bihar.

title: Apple Leases Office In Bengaluru, To Pay Rs 6.3 Crore Monthly Rent
content: iPhone maker Apple India has leased around 2.7 lakh square feet of office space in Bangalore for 10 years with a starting monthly rent of Rs 6.3 crore, according to data analytics firm Propstack.

title: Trump Administration To Discuss Taking 10% In Intel: Report
content: The Trump administration is said to discuss taking a 10% stake in American chipmaker Intel, Bloomberg News reported on Monday, citing a White House official and other people familiar with the matter.

title: Congress To Take Call On Veep, DMK Leader, Ex-ISRO Scientist On List: Sources
content: The INDIA bloc has authorized Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge to take a call on the Opposition candidate for the post of the Vice-President who will face NDA candidate CP Radhakrishnan -- the Governor of Maharashtra - on September 9.

title: 14 Killed In Russian Attack On Ukraine Ahead Of Trump-Zelensky Talks
content: Russian attacks, including on an apartment block in Kharkiv city, killed 14 people across Ukraine, authorities said Monday, ahead of talks in Washington between President Volodymyr Zelensky and US leader Donald Trump.

title: "Make In India Need Not Become Make All That India Needs": RBI Ex-Governor
content: Sounding a note of caution, former RBI Governor D Subbarao on Monday said that 'Make in India' should not transform into 'Make all that India needs' as it would hurt investments in the country and impact productivity.

title: Rajasthan Constable Attacks Wife, Son Ahead Of Divorce Hearing, Dies By Suicide Later
content: Days before he was to appear for a divorce hearing, a constable in Rajasthan's Jhunjhunu attacked his wife and six-year-old son with a sword and then died by suicide.

title: "Must Be Prepared At Every Moment For Confrontation.": Iran On Conflict With Israel
content: A senior Iranian official warned Monday that war with Israel could erupt at any moment, describing the current lull after June's 12-day conflict as only a temporary halt.

title: Mumbai Rain Highlights: Schools To Be Shut On Tuesday, Red Alert Issued
content: Mumbai Rain Highlights: Several parts of Mumbai received more than 100 mm rainfall in nine hours on Monday, with Vikhroli in the eastern suburbs topping the chart

title: Shubhanshu Shukla Shows Pics Of Earth From Space During Meet With PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla this evening, a day after the astronaut returned to India after his historic visit to the International Space Station (ISS).

title: Indian Truck Driver's Fatal U-Turn Sparks Team Trump vs California Governor
content: The violent crash in Florida, which killed three people, has become the latest flashpoint between the Donald Trump administration and California Governor Gavin Newsom.

title: Mega Drug Lab Busted In Bhopal, Second In Less Than A Year
content: A sprawling illegal drug factory was busted in Bhopal on Monday, adding to concerns about the Madhya Pradesh capital emerging as a hub for the production and trade of synthetic narcotics.

title: BJP MLA Demands UPs Ghazipur Be Named After Seer Parashurams Son
content: BJP MLA from Bansdih Assembly constituency, Ketki Singh, on Monday urged the Centre and the state government to rename Ghazipur after Maharishi Gautam, the father of Maharishi Parashuram.

title: 8 Year-Old-Boy Killed By Cousin For Rs 10-Lakh Ransom In UP
content: An eight-year-old boy was allegedly kidnapped and killed by his cousin here for a ransom of Rs 10 lakh, police said on Monday.

title: Strike By 10,000 Air Canada Flight Attendants Declared Illegal
content: The Canada Industrial Relations Board declared a strike by 10,000 Air Canada flight attendants illegal Monday and ordered them back on the job after they ignored an earlier order to return to work and submit to arbitration.

title: Actual Probe Begins After Forensic Reports: Karnataka Minister on Dharmasthala case
content: Karnataka Home Minister G Parameshwara has formally briefed the state assembly on the ongoing investigation into the alleged mass burials at Dharmasthala, stressing that the case is still at a preliminary stage.

title: 28-Year-Old Son Of Norway Princess Charged With 4 Rapes
content: The 28-year-old son of Norway's crown princess has been charged with raping four women and several acts of violence, and risks up to 10 years in prison, a prosecutor said on Monday.

title: Railways Understated Working Expenses In 2022-23: CAG Report
content: Railway's total earnings and expenditure from its operations when compared with its cross subsidising records showed that it understated its expenditure in the financial year 2022-23 by more then 5,000 crore.

title: Hamas Agrees To New Gaza Ceasefire Proposal: Report
content: A Hamas source told AFP on Monday that the Palestinian militants had agreed to a new proposal for a ceasefire in Gaza, devastated by more than 22 months of war between the Islamist group and Israel.
